channel.title: Posts on AI Survival Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on AI Survival Blog

item.title: Vertical AI Unicorns Are Emerging
item.description: The horizontal model layer is saturated. The vertical application layer is where new unicorns form.

item.title: Thinkers vs Doers: The AI Workforce Reveal
item.description: AI automation is revealing a hidden truth about the workforce: who can define problems and who can only execute tasks. Engineers and multi-domain thinkers are positioned to thrive.

item.title: Why South Korea Will Dominate 2026: The Perfect Convergence
item.description: US markets are cooling while Asia heats up. South Korea sits at the perfect intersection: undervalued currency, political stability, AI manufacturing boom, and improving governance. Here's why 2026 could be Korea's year.

item.title: Energy & Infrastructure News - Week 8, 2026
item.description: Data centers evolve from power consumers to grid stakeholders. US data center power demand could reach 106 GW by 2035. Big Tech's 'All of the Above' power strategy.

item.title: Confident Ignorance: How LLMs Make You Feel Smart About Being Wrong
item.description: LLMs amplify your current state—they don't fix your blind spots. Learn how to avoid the trap of confident ignorance and build a verification framework that works.

item.title: The Service Industry Paradox: When Digital Becomes Air
item.description: Non-physical services are becoming free. The real opportunity? Invest in what AI cannot touch.

item.title: When Digital Services Become Air: The Paradox of Value in the AI Economy
item.description: AI is making non-physical services abundant. But here's the paradox: when something becomes as common as air, its economic value collapses. Where does value migrate?

item.title: Global AI/Tech Investment News - Week 8, 2026
item.description: OpenAI's record round, Anthropic's $30B raise, India's $200B+ AI infrastructure push, and the emerging World Model race.

item.title: AI Agents as Economic Entities: The Future of Digital Labor (Part 3)
item.description: AI agents already trade, invest, and create. But legally, they're still 'tools.' Can they become economic entities? Should they?

item.title: Data Centers Surpass Commercial Real Estate: What It Means (Part 2)
item.description: In 2025, data center construction spending surpassed office building construction in the US. This isn't just a tech trend—it's a historical shift in where humans live and work.

item.title: When Energy Cost Approaches Zero: The Society That Will Unfold (Part 1)
item.description: 2,600GW waiting in grid queues. Super Power emerging. We're not approaching energy abundance—we're already there, if we can clear the bottleneck.

item.title: The AI Biotech Survival Playbook: Lessons from AbCellera
item.description: AbCellera's struggle reveals the new rules of AI-era biotech survival. Platform dominance, data moats, and the death of traditional competitive advantages.
